title: Broken views are not removed

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

Spack does not remove old views. I see these directories:

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ ls -l view
lrwxrwxrwx 1 eschnetter users 75 May 20 09:00 view -> /home/eschnetter/src/CarpetX/Cactus/._view/nm4xsrwttcelwxk52vwmizwwnhxq4wd2
$ ls -l ._view
total 16
drwxr-xr-x 16 eschnetter users 8192 May 20 09:00 nm4xsrwttcelwxk52vwmizwwnhxq4wd2
drwxr-xr-x  9 eschnetter users 8192 May 19 22:42 ojcoqmogozxypeoozhzh5bzqzrbcslax
```

The directory "._view/ojcoqmogozxypeoozhzh5bzqzrbcslax" is outdated. Spack should remove it.

I believe I may have interrupted Spack while creating an earlier view, or it ran out of CPU time.

Spack should remove all partial views when a new view is generated successfully.

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

```
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-2761-d2e22d7fe4
* **Python:** 3.6.9
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake_avx512
* **Concretizer:** original
```
